# Matplotlib xy limits 

Matplotlib automatically detects what values are plotted, and draws axis that displays all the points. 

However, sometimes we may want to force the x and y axis plot a certain region - e.g. 0-100% on a y axis. 

We can do this by setting `plt.xlim()` or `plt.ylim()`. 

```{python}
# Import matplotlib
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 

# Define lists 
species = ["Voles", "Frogs", "Otters", "Nematodes", "Eels"]
percent_survival = [10, 39, 1, 22, 5]

# plot as a bar chart 
plt.bar(species, percent_survival)

# set ylim to between 0 and 100
plt.ylim(0,100)

# show graph 
plt.show()
```
